summary: The African Diaspora Council Act establishes an advisory council within the Department of State. This council, composed of up to 12 members from diverse African diaspora communities in the United States, will advise the President, through the Secretary of State, on strengthening connections between the U.S. government and the African diaspora. The council will focus on strategies to advance equity and opportunity, support the UN forum on people of African descent, and enhance cultural, economic, and educational ties between the United States and Africa, including Prosper Africa and Young African Leaders Initiative.
